intro: Cyanea angustifolia var. elliptica, commonly known as the narrow-leaved Cyanea, is a flowering plant native to the Hawaiian Islands. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its elliptical, narrow leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. The plant produces small, fragrant flowers that are typically white or pale pink, arranged in clusters. It thrives in moist, shaded environments, often found in coastal or forested areas. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
